definition: to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver

sentences.english: But it is a big mistake to tell too many people where you're heading.
sentences.chinese: 但不能告訴太多人你的方向，否則將鑄成大錯。

sentences.english: Acceptance of this view would end up in gross errors.
sentences.chinese: 接受這種觀點就會鑄成大錯。

sentences.english: Such an attack would be a mistake.
Ignoring the rural market, we believe, is a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我們相信，不進軍農村市場的企業正鑄成大錯。
